ygData.subject: RE: about the new enchant items (long rant)
ygData.msgSnippet: Just for the sake of discussion then: Can an enchanter solo without a pet? at all levels? and If so, with what tactics? What have you all tested? I wouldn t be
ygData.messageBody:
Just for the sake of discussion then: Can an enchanter solo without a pet?
at all levels? and If so, with what tactics? What have you all tested?

I wouldn't be willing to loose the extremely useful pet series of spells
until I can figure out how to make up for the loss of the "baby tank" in
combat. To me it is what makes soloing bearable. Lets face it, while I would
prefer to be in a group, there are times where it is either solo or don't
play.

Tharkun / Veeshan

-----Original Message-----
From: refplace [mailto:refplace@...]
Sent: Wednesday, July 21, 1999 11:37 PM
To: eqenchanters@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [eqenchanters] about the new enchant items (long rant)


From: "refplace" <refplace@...>



>From: XIII <dlepriol@...>
>
>Party pooper, party pooper. Ok you know the song, this time I fill the role
>:).
>
> May I point out that the message said that the code was going to be
>implemented, not that -we- enchanters are going to benefit from it. True,
>it was stated in the book we could do it, but at no time in B4 it was in
>effect, and, according to EQE, we received other benefits to make up for
it.
>
> As I see it, such thing would overbalance us (enchanters) in regard of
>other pure spell user classes. So either the benefit will be too small to
>even consider it or too huge and Verant might take out something in return
>to balance our classe again. Don't tell me we're nerfed now. We were, true,
>but that was sometime ago and from my point of view we are rather balanced
>regarding other pure spell users. To sum up we have our "niche".
>
> So, the idea is: By talking here, and offering Verant options to consider
>we may have a say in the matter and make our class fuller in the way -we-
>see it. What I would like to see discussed here is : What can we give up to
>have a 'proper' enchantment line of spells?. Or are we just to receive this
>new ability/spell/line of spells without giving up anything?.
>
> As stated above, I dont think we can't expect a 'useful' line of
>enchantment's spells unless we give up something in exchange. Thinking back
>of Beta, there was a line of spells we didn't have but nonetheless still
>managed to survive and prosper : Pet line of spells. Plus they don't fit
>enchanters very well . On the other hand, this line form the very core of
>most of our solo strategies so losing it wouldn't be a small thing.
>
> This is just an example, a topic's starter. Feel free to agree, disagree
>or tell me to shut up. Once again my aim to to talk things out here first
>and offer something (petition/ EQE/ you name it) constructive to Verant
>before we see something not implemented or half implemented in place.
>
>Best,
>Ibnabeth / Karana
>still going up


I would be hapy to lose our pets.
I went up to 9th level before seriously using a pet.
Give us spells so we are wanted in a group even at low levels so that we can
always find a group and I'll happily give up my pet for good. Even take
charm if ya like.
However Enchantments I see as a form of trade skill and people will want you
to create tehm for them at little or no cost but tehn when it comes to
partying ask waht you can do in a fight.
That are give you a pity spot in the party to keep those temp enchantments
coming. I dont see Enchantments having such a huge effect on our class no
matter what form they take.
Stonedreamer
